instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_LSOC_RST_L: What is SMC_LSOC_RST_L? SMC_LSOC_RST_L is a signal that comes out of the trackpad on Macbook Airs that can reset the SMC.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.PP3V3_S4_IPD: What is PP3V3_S4_IPD? PP3V3_S4_IPD is a 3.3v power rail for powering the trackpad and keyboard on a Macbook Air. If the keyboard and trackpad are not powering, check the resistor that functions as a fuse between PP3V3_S4 and PP3V3_S4_IPD as it may have blown. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO KEYBOARD OR TRACKPAD
threads.message:
Hi, this board is turning on, but when I get to the login screen, trackpad and mouse, just don´t work... But if I press ALT when the computer is starting, they both work, so it is not the keyboard nor the trackpad.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_IPD</SIGNAL> = 5.1
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_IPD</SIGNAL> = 3.3
<SIGNAL>SMC_LSOC_RST_L</SIGNAL> = 3.4
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> = 3.4

never seen one like this...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO KEYBOARD OR TRACKPAD
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R4850</RESISTOR>-53.
Post <CHIP>U4810</CHIP> voltage, on the login screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO KEYBOARD OR TRACKPAD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO KEYBOARD OR TRACKPAD
threads.message:
<CHIP>U4810</CHIP> looks good.
Are you sure the 4 resistors all good?

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> steady high at J4800?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO KEYBOARD OR TRACKPAD
threads.message:
All ohm values on <RESISTOR>R4850</RESISTOR>-53 are  OK
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 3.42 steady

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO KEYBOARD OR TRACKPAD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO KEYBOARD OR TRACKPAD
threads.message: The trackpad and keyboard work fine, I used a different board to see if it worked, and it did just fine...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO KEYBOARD OR TRACKPAD
threads.message:
Then you have problems with trackpad connector, o a <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI</SIGNAL> data line.

Just in case, check/replace R/<TRANSISTOR>Q4860</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO KEYBOARD OR TRACKPAD
threads.message: I replaced <RESISTOR>R4860</RESISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q4860</TRANSISTOR> still the same... I checked all <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI</SIGNAL> lines and all seems to be good, the resistors have their values... no open or broken resistor...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO KEYBOARD OR TRACKPAD
threads.message:
Then bad PCH.
As last chance, change trackpad connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO KEYBOARD OR TRACKPAD
threads.message: I don´t see why to change the connector, when I start the computer pressing ALT (Option) key, mouse and keyboard work fine, even the CAPS green light works, as soon as I leave the boot menu and the system starts loading I loose them both... worth reflowing the PCH ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO KEYBOARD OR TRACKPAD
threads.message:
Before loading macOS drivers, trackpad works in USB mode.
After that, PCH enables SPI mode.
So should be PCH issue, or bad contacts on the SPI lines.
